body:
More of a feature request as I haven't fleshed out all the details yet.

Right now the only way I can configure config maps and secrets from files is to copy entire file contents (and base 64 for secrets) into the values files or --set, its a bit awkward.

Lets say I have an RSA key, at the moment I base64 this, strip whitespace and put it into my values file:

```yaml
rsaPrivateKey: ""
```
I know we have access to `(.Files.Glob "foo/*").AsConfig`  and `(.Files.Glob "bar/*").AsSecrets`, but this is restricted to files inside the chart. 

Perhaps we could use go template engine on the value file itself, like:

```yaml
rsaPrivateKey: {{ (.Files.Glob "*.key.pem").AsSecrets }}
```

This would give helm more flexibility, but also more complexity. The functionality could more restricted than whats in chart template files, perhaps even with a different syntax/engine. I'm not sure how it would work with relative paths, that is something we would have to figure out.

I have a feeling this was what #1662 was trying to get across, but I'm not sure. Has anyone else felt like this is needed?

P.S I am so happy with helm, its a great tool and I think you guys are doing a great job.
